text: [Music]
well I I I think more and more um LGBT
people realize that we're all on the
same page for equality and fairness uh
to be treated equally and to be treated
fairly within Society there are there
are some folks within the community who
believe that marriage equality um is not
something that we have to push for
immediately um that they they would
settle quote unquote to use some terms
we'd settle for civil unions in in that
case um but really the the role of
movement leadership I think is to
articulate a vision for what is right
and for where we should end up and we
realize that there's going to be steps
along the way to get there um but the
vision is full equality in this society
and that's marriage equality that's
being able to serve openly in the
military that's being able to work
without fear of being fired because you
you want to live authentically and live
openly so there's um I think there's
more and more agreement within the LGBT
community than there is division and I
think part of our role as LGBT leaders
is to focus on where we're United and
bring people together
[Music]
